icss_emacDrv.c File Reference

Contains the Rx and Tx functions for packet processing on ARM including the ISR for two PRU. More...

ICSS_EmacClearIrq

Clears interrupt Function. There are 2 possible sequence for clearing interrupt. Failure to follow this sequence may result into race condition.

  1. Level sensitive interrupt controllers: a) clear interrupt via SECR
  2. Edge sensitive interrupt controllers: a) disable interrupt via EICR b) clear interrupt via SECR c) enable interrupt via EISR.
Parameters
Handleicss_emac handle intNum: interrupt number
Return values
none
static void ICSS_EmacClearIrq (ICSS_EmacHandle icssemacHandle, uint32_t intNum)

Detailed Description

Contains the Rx and Tx functions for packet processing on ARM including the ISR for two PRU.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define ETHERNET_FRAME_SIZE_60   (60U)

Minimum supported size of Ethernet frame

Function Documentation

int32_t ICSS_EmacGetMaxQueueFillLevel ( ICSS_EmacHandle  icssEmacHandle,
int32_t  portNumber,
int32_t  queuePriority,
uint8_t  queueType,
int32_t *  queueOverflowCount 
)

Description
Finds the maximum fill level of the queue in terms of 32 byte blocks. For example, if there was only one 64 byte packet received when this API is called then it would return value of 2. It also returns number of times queue has overflown.

Parameters
[in]icssEmacHandlehandle to ICSS_EMAC Instance.
[in]portNumberPort on which queue resides. Valid values are: 0 == PORT0, 1 == PORT1, 2 == PORT2
[in]queuePriorityPriority of the queue or queue number whose fill level has to be found
[in]queueTypeRx/Tx Queue
[out]queueOverflowCountNumber of times queue has overflown
Return values
Themaximum fill level of the queue in terms of 32 byte blocks or <0 if there was an error in the input parameters
int32_t ICSS_EmacGetQueueOverflowCount ( ICSS_EmacHandle  icssEmacHandle,
int32_t  portNumber,
int32_t  queuePriority 
)

Description
returns the queueOverflowCount for a host/port queue

Parameters
[in]icssEmacHandlehandle to ICSS_EMAC Instance.
[in]portNumberPort on which queue resides. Valid values are: 0 == PORT0, 1 == PORT1, 2 == PORT2
[in]queuePriorityPriority of the queue or queue number whose fill level has to be found
Return values
queueOverflowCountNumber of times queue has overflown <0 if there was an error in the input parameters

int32_t ICSS_EmacRxPktGet ( ICSS_EmacRxArgument *  rxArg,
void *  userArg 
)

Description
Retrieves a frame from a host queue and copies it in the allocated stack buffer

Parameters
[in]rxArgdefined at ICSS_EmacRxArgument
[in]userArgcustom Rx packet callback packet options only required for custom RxPacket implementations, default to NULL when calling ICSS_EmacRxPktGet which is default Tx Packet API
Return values
Lengthof the frame received in number of bytes or -1 on Failure
int32_t ICSS_EmacRxPktInfo ( ICSS_EmacHandle  icssEmacHandle,
int32_t *  portNumber,
int32_t *  queueNumber 
)

Description
API to retrieve the information about the received frame which is then used to dequeue the frame from the host queues

Parameters
[in]icssEmacHandlehandle to ICSS_EMAC Instance.
[out]portNumberReturn pointer of port number where frame was received
[out]queueNumberReturn pointer of host queue where the received frame is queued
Return values
Lengthof packet or 0 if no packet found
int32_t ICSS_EmacRxPktInfo2 ( ICSS_EmacHandle  icssEmacHandle,
ICSS_EmacPktInfo *  pRxPktInfo 
)

Description
AP to retrieve the information about the received frame which is then used to dequeue the frame from the host queues. This version fo the API also allows for pointer to the address of read buffer in L3 address space to be returned. This is an enhancement to the ICSS_EmacRxPktInfo API.

Parameters
[in]icssEmacHandlehandle to ICSS_EMAC Instance.
[out]pRxPktInfoReturn pointer of receive packet info which includes port number where frame was received, host queue where the received frame is queued and address of read buffer in L3 address space.
Return values
Lengthof packet or 0 if no packet found
int32_t ICSS_EmacTxPacket ( const ICSS_EmacTxArgument *  txArg,
void *  userArg 
)

Description
API to queue a frame which has to be transmitted on the specified port queue

Parameters
[in]txArgdefined at ICSS_EmacTxArgument
[in]userArgcustom Tx packet callback packet options only required for custom TxPacket implementations, default to NULL when calling ICSS_EmacTxPacket which is default Tx Packet API
Return values
0on scuess, <0 on failure
int32_t ICSS_EmacTxPacketEnqueue ( ICSS_EmacHandle  icssEmacHandle,
const uint8_t *  srcAddress,
uint8_t  portNumber,
uint8_t  queuePriority,
uint16_t  lengthOfPacket 
)

API to copy a packet from DDR to Tx Queue memory on L3 and synchronize with firmware.

Parameters
[in]icssEmacHandlehandle to ICSS_EMAC Instance.
[in]srcAddressBase address of the buffer where the frame to be transmitted resides
[in]portNumberPort on which frame has to be transmitted. Valid values are: 1 == PORT1, 2 == PORT2
[in]queuePriorityQueue number in which frame will be queued for transmission
[in]lengthOfPacketlength of the frame in bytes
Return values
0on scuess, <0 on failure
